arg1.author: danieljf
arg1.text: "In 2006, the Alliance for a Healthier Generation and the American Beverage Association worked together to develop a set of National School Beverage Guidelines. This was prepared to reduce the calories delivered to schools by beverage companies and in return promote healthier school choices for children. The articles illustrate the program and significant results thus far. Since its inception there has been a 58% cut in total calories contained in all beverages shipped to schools. Further, a survey was taken of parents, pediatricians and family physicians. The highest supported choice for each group was bottled water." (http://www.nikawater.org/bottled-water/ )
arg1.originalHTML: "In 2006, the Alliance for a Healthier Generation and the American Beverage Association worked together to develop a set of National School Beverage Guidelines. This was prepared to reduce the calories delivered to schools by beverage companies and in return promote healthier school choices for children. The articles illustrate the program and significant results thus far. Since its inception there has been a 58% cut in total calories contained in all beverages shipped to schools. Further, a survey was taken of parents, pediatricians and family physicians. The highest supported choice for each group was bottled water." (http://www.nikawater.org/bottled-water/ )

arg2.author: danieljf
arg2.text: Americans spend billions on bottled water every year. Banning their sale would greatly hurt an already struggling economy. In addition to the actual sale of water bottles, the plastics that they are made out of, and the advertising on both the bottles and packaging are also big business. In addition to this, compostable waters bottle are also coming onto the market, these can be used instead of plastics to eliminate that detriment. Moreover, bottled water not only has a cleaner safety record than municipal water, but it easier to trace when a potential health risk does occur. (http://www.friendsjournal.org/bottled-water) (http://www.cdc.gov/healthywater/drinking/bottled/)
arg2.originalHTML:
Americans spend billions on bottled water every year. Banning their sale would greatly hurt an already struggling economy. In addition to the actual sale of water bottles, the plastics that they are made out of, and the advertising on both the bottles and packaging are also big business. In addition to this, compostable waters bottle are also coming onto the market, these can be used instead of plastics to eliminate that detriment. Moreover, bottled water not only has a cleaner safety record than municipal water, but it easier to trace when a potential health risk does occur.

(http://www.friendsjournal.org/bottled-water) (http://www.cdc.gov/healthywater/drinking/bottled/)

debateMetaData.title: Ban Plastic Water Bottles
debateMetaData.description:
Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

A1 shows a definite health benefit to using bottled water in schools. A2 shows several reasons why banning bottled water would hurt the economy.
A2 is more convincing because it lays out the economic and environmental factors clearly
A1 doesn't address the issue at hand, but rather nutrition and calories (of which water does not provide). A2 argues on cost.
A1 makes some good points on childhood obesity

arg1.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.
arg1.originalHTML: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

The articles illustrate the program and significant results thus far. Since its inception there has been a 58% cut in total calories contained in all beverages shipped to schools. Further, a survey was taken of parents, pediatricians and family physicians. The highest supported choice for each group was bottled water." (http://www.nikawater.org/bottled-water/ )

debateMetaData.title: Ban Plastic Water Bottles
debateMetaData.description:
Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg1.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg1.author: danieljf
arg1.text: Americans spend billions on bottled water every year. Banning their sale would greatly hurt an already struggling economy. In addition to the actual sale of water bottles, the plastics that they are made out of, and the advertising on both the bottles and packaging are also big business. In addition to this, compostable waters bottle are also coming onto the market, these can be used instead of plastics to eliminate that detriment. Moreover, bottled water not only has a cleaner safety record than municipal water, but it easier to trace when a potential health risk does occur. (http://www.friendsjournal.org/bottled-water) (http://www.cdc.gov/healthywater/drinking/bottled/)

arg1.text: Americans spend billions on bottled water every year. Banning their sale would greatly hurt an already struggling economy. In addition to the actual sale of water bottles, the plastics that they are made out of, and the advertising on both the bottles and packaging are also big business. In addition to this, compostable waters bottle are also coming onto the market, these can be used instead of plastics to eliminate that detriment. Moreover, bottled water not only has a cleaner safety record than municipal water, but it easier to trace when a potential health risk does occur. (http://www.friendsjournal.org/bottled-water) (http://www.cdc.gov/healthywater/drinking/bottled/)

arg2.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg1.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

In addition to the actual sale of water bottles, the plastics that they are made out of, and the advertising on both the bottles and packaging are also big business. In addition to this, compostable waters bottle are also coming onto the market, these can be used instead of plastics to eliminate that detriment. Moreover, bottled water not only has a cleaner safety record than municipal water, but it easier to trace when a potential health risk does occur.

(http://www.friendsjournal.org/bottled-water) (http://www.cdc.gov/healthywater/drinking/bottled/)

arg1.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

(Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

A1 talks about the importance of industry.
A2 is purely an opinion with no facts
A1 sticks more to the point of the question, as opposed to A2 talking about obesity which relates nothing to the economics in this case
A2 is considered a slippery slope rather than a legit argument as A1 which sounds more convincing on syntax alone.

arg1.text: Bottled water consumption has grown exponentially over the past ten to fifteen years. This growth has taken place globally, but particularly in Europe and North America. The bottled water industry has literally created its own water culture which is good for american industries.
arg1.originalHTML: Bottled water consumption has grown exponentially over the past ten to fifteen years. This growth has taken place globally, but particularly in Europe and North America. The bottled water industry has literally created its own water culture which is good for american industries.

arg2.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg1.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

debateMetaData.title: Ban Plastic Water Bottles
debateMetaData.description:
Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg1.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

mTurkAssignment.reason: A1 provides detailed statistics to support the argument.
Both arguments are good and factual but A2 provides a source making it slightly better
A2 states their standpoint and explains it better than A1 does.
There are just facts of economic impact and not opinion for stating a case
These are both well reasoned and very complete arguments. It's hard to give the edge to either one because they are about the same.

arg1.text: Western Europe consumes almost 50% of the world's bottled water. Many claim that this is due to European culture, since the continent has had very polluted waters due to agriculture and industry dating back to the Industrial Revolution. The water bottles they buy help us.
arg1.originalHTML: Western Europe consumes almost 50% of the world's bottled water. Many claim that this is due to European culture, since the continent has had very polluted waters due to agriculture and industry dating back to the Industrial Revolution. The water bottles they buy help us.

arg2.author: diegocrawfor
arg2.text: Banning plastic bottled water would be a huge mistake in this very moment. More than a million people in the United States purchase bottled water every day which is helping the economy com out of this recession we are in. maybe not in a big way but every kid of help counts! Bottled water also only makes less then 1&#xof; the worlds wastes and can be recycled! According to the National Association for PET Container resources, PET water bottles are no the most recycled container in curb side programs by weight and by number! http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/Video/index.html?@videoList.featured=31101711001

arg2.author: torie
arg2.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg2.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg1.author: nickbrighton
arg1.text: bottled water is not bad for the world because after youre done drinking your bottle of water you can re-use it several times to have serval bottles of water using less plastic. plastic is also recyclable and can make new objects such as more plastic bottles so technically you can re-use and re-use the same plastic bottle over and over again. it will not be bad for the economy if we figure out how to reuse properly.

arg1.author: diegocrawfor
arg1.text: Banning plastic bottled water would be a huge mistake in this very moment. More than a million people in the United States purchase bottled water every day which is helping the economy com out of this recession we are in. maybe not in a big way but every kid of help counts! Bottled water also only makes less then 1&#xof; the worlds wastes and can be recycled! According to the National Association for PET Container resources, PET water bottles are no the most recycled container in curb side programs by weight and by number! http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/Video/index.html?@videoList.featured=31101711001

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg2.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

arg2.author: torie
arg2.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg2.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg1.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg2.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

arg2.author: torie
arg2.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg2.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg1.text: Western Europe consumes almost 50% of the world's bottled water. Many claim that this is due to European culture, since the continent has had very polluted waters due to agriculture and industry dating back to the Industrial Revolution. The water bottles they buy help us.
arg1.originalHTML: Western Europe consumes almost 50% of the world's bottled water. Many claim that this is due to European culture, since the continent has had very polluted waters due to agriculture and industry dating back to the Industrial Revolution. The water bottles they buy help us.

arg2.text: U.S. alone grew by over 13%. According to research and consulting done by the Beverage Marketing Corporation, the global bottled water industry has exploded to over $35 billion. Americans alone paid $7.7 billion for bottled water in 2002. In 2001, for example globally bottled water companies produced over 130,000 million liters of water. This produced roughly 35,000 million dollars in revenue for the world's thousands of bottled water companies in 2001.

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg1.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

(Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

mTurkAssignment.reason: A2 presents a more detailed argument.
A1 gives some good facts about Europe to defend the argument
A2 is marginally better, but both have pretty weak logic
Both arguments use specific, convincing arguments to support their standpoints.
A2 shows they researched and know about the topic and their argument

arg1.text: Western Europe consumes almost 50% of the world's bottled water. Many claim that this is due to European culture, since the continent has had very polluted waters due to agriculture and industry dating back to the Industrial Revolution. The water bottles they buy help us.
arg1.originalHTML: Western Europe consumes almost 50% of the world's bottled water. Many claim that this is due to European culture, since the continent has had very polluted waters due to agriculture and industry dating back to the Industrial Revolution. The water bottles they buy help us.

arg2.author: torie
arg2.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg2.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.
arg1.originalHTML: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg1.author: torie
arg1.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

debateMetaData.title: Ban Plastic Water Bottles
debateMetaData.description:
Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes

arg2.author: torie
arg2.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

All other beverages consume huge amounts of water and energy during their production processes, which makes their ecological impact far more detrimental than that of bottled water." http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address;=103x347180
arg1.originalHTML: “Bottled water is not our biggest problem when it comes to drinking habits. All other beverages consume huge amounts of water and energy during their production processes, which makes their ecological impact far more detrimental than that of bottled water.” http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address;=103x347180

arg2.author: torie
arg2.text: "At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip. To maintain the purity of our water, we employ a comprehensive, multi-barrier filtration system that involves carefully controlled and continuously monitored disinfection processes in hygienically designed lines. We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx
arg2.originalHTML:
"At Poland Spring, we know that freshness and consistency go hand in hand. Our rigorous quality control standards help us make sure that you will enjoy the same crisp, delicious water every time you take a sip.

We test our water when it comes into the plant and for consistency several times per hour at every stage of the bottling process. Every year, we screen for over 200 possible contaminants-far more than state and federal regulations require."-nuff said

http://delivery.polandspring.com/Delivery/home/help/OurWater.aspx

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

debateMetaData.title: Ban Plastic Water Bottles
debateMetaData.description:
Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

debateMetaData.title: Ban Plastic Water Bottles
debateMetaData.description:
Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

Some people think that bottled water is bad for consumers and should only be used in situations such as disasters when no other clean water is available. arg2.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. (Problems: Pollution, Shipping, BPA contamination, unfair profits, water mining, etc.) http://www.mnn.com/food/healthy-eating/stories/5-reasons-not-to-drink-bottled-water Others believe that it is a natural and healthy portable drink and that it is good for the economy for the companies to make big profits. http://www.nestlewaterscorporate.com/bottled_water_things_to_know/ If you are on the left side of the room - No If you are on the right side of the room - Yes
You need to research and cite at least 2 facts to support your opinion. They must be different than the facts that have already been posted.Write at least one well thought out paragraph supported by your facts citing websites that are reliable and valid

mTurkAssignment.reason: A2 seemed to go in a completely different direction then was the focus of the argument.
A1 is a statement without proof, while A2 provides some reasoning behind its claims.
A2 presents facts and a reference.
neither statement is strong; A1 is pure opinion, A2 is a quote without connecting material
A2 gives more thought out reasoning.

arg1.text: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.
arg1.originalHTML: Bottled water is somewhat less likely to be found in developing countries, where public water is least safe to drink. Many government programs regularly disperse bottled water for various reasons. Distributing small bottles of water is much easier than distributing large bulk storages of water. Also contamination from large water storage containers is much more likely than from single 12-20 ounce bottles of water.

arg2.author: danieljf
arg2.text: "Bottled water is not our biggest problem when it comes to drinking habits.
